description.narrative: Conservation and sustainable use of marine and coastal biodiversity through effectively and equitably managed marine-coastal protected areas, which will contribute to improving the economic welfare of the Guatemalan population.

populated place

activity-description.narrative: promoverá la conservación y el uso sostenible en el largo plazo de la biodiversidad marina y costera de importancia global a través del manejo efectivo y de manera equitativa de las áreas protegidas marino costeras (APM), que a su vez contribuirán a mejorar el bienestar económico de la población gua

description.narrative: Addressing threats from key sectors fisheries maritime portstransportation and urban development in order to strengthen MPAs management and the conservation and sustainable use of marineand coastal BD in the Pacific region of Guatemala
12 Number of nurseries certified by CONAP for their good practices and compliance with the official Guidelines of the National Strategy for Sea Turtle Conservation in Guatemala

comment.narrative: 0 nurseries

Three 3 nurseries to be certified by CONAP
1 MonterricoCECON Center for Conservation Studies
2 HawaiiARCAS Wildlife Rescue and Conservation Association
3 SipacateICC Private Institute for Climate Change

This is a new indicator
A revision of the National Strategy for Sea Turtle Conservation in Guatemala was requested by CONAP It was noticed that the Guidelines for release of sea turtle hatchlings are not being implemented satisfactory in the Pacific nurseries This is why the nurseries need to be certified

description.narrative:
13 Minimum sizes cm of select fish species in four 4 multipleuse MPAs and their buffer zones in conformance with FAO regulations1
1 The regulation proposed by the FAO is aimed at the minimum sizes in the case of fisheries maximum sizes are not considered since the concern with the stocks of fish is that the organisms reach at least their initial reproduction size which allows them to maintain stable populations For other species there are no regulations regarding sizes

comment.narrative:
Commercially important species
White Shrimp Litopenaeus vannamei
Blue Shrimp Penaeus stylirostris
Brown Shrimp Farfantepenaeus
californiensis
Hammerhead Shark Sphyrna lewini

Commercially important species
White Shrimp Litopenaeus vannamei 3 g or 66 cm
Blue Shrimp Penaeus stylirostris 3 g or 66 cm
Brown Shrimp Farfantepenaeus californiensis 3 g or 66 cm
Hammerhead Shark Sphyrna lewini 220 cm total length for females and 178 cm for males

Two initiatives leaded by DIPESCAMAGA and CONAP focused on sharks including Hammerhead Shark and manta rays conservation started this year
The first one is the characterization and assessment of state and the second one is a marketing chain and traceability system for these species Both processes will support the country to accomplish acquired compromises as a CITES Contracting Party
Compliance with the regulations of the General Law of Fishing and Aquaculture favors stable catches and sizes of four 4 selected fishing species
Baseline use of 600 meters gillnet mesh size of inches and 8 simultaneous gill nets illegal fishing gear
Target use of 100 meters gillnet 25 inches mesh size and 3 gillnets maximum Article 50 Literal H of the normative of the General Law of Fishing and Aquaculture contributes to sustainable use of
1 Snapper Lutjanus sp
2 Yellowfin Snook Centropomus robalito
3 Mackerel Scomberomorus sierra
4 White Shrimp Litopenaeus vannamei

Commercially important species
White Shrimp Litopenaeus vannamei 3 g or 66 cm
Blue Shrimp Penaeus stylirostris 3 g or 66 cm
Brown Shrimp Farfantepenaeus californiensis 3 g or 66 cm

description.narrative: 11 Coverage ha of key marinecoastal ecosystems in five 5 MPAs and their buffer zones

comment.narrative:
Estuaries 1715 ha
Coastal lagoons 2141 ha
Herbaceous wetlands 8138 ha
Sandy beaches 21135 ha
Muddy beaches 3858 ha
Current levels are maintained

In order to maintain current levels of conservation and sustainable use of marinecoastal biodiversity two initiatives requested by CONAP have been supported Regulations for Whale Watching were published in the official gazette and the Hunting Calendar for the South Coast has been updated
Progress of this target will be measure by mid2017 before the midterm review which is planned for latter 2017
Current levels are maintained

In order to maintain current levels of conservation and sustainable use of marinecoastal biodiversity two initiatives requested by CONAP have been supported Regulations for Whale Watching were published in the official gazette and the Hunting Calendar for the South Coast has been updated
Progress of this target will be measure by mid2017 before the midterm review which is planned for latter 2017

description.narrative: Strengthening the MPA legal policy and financial frameworks for the protection of marinecoastal BD and its sustainable use
6 Total annual budget from the central government USD assigned to the management of the MPAs and amount of financial resources received annually from private sources for the MPAs management

comment.narrative: 84165810 25 increase

Work plan agreed with OCRET and CONAP regarding coastal land rates and legal reforms for the financial sustainability of MPAs Synergy with the BIOFIN project for viability of a financial mechanism Progress of this target will be measure by mid2017 before the midterm review which is planned for latter 2017
Note A change of the target level is requested with the support of the Technical Committee A more realistic amount could be a 25 increase equivalent to 84165810 instead of a 50 increase
84165810 25 increase

Work plan agreed with OCRET and CONAP regarding coastal land rates and legal reforms for the financial sustainability of MPAs Synergy with the BIOFIN project for viability of a financial mechanism Progress of this target will be measure by mid2017 before the midterm review which is planned for latter 2017
Note A change of the target level is requested with the support of the Technical Committee A more realistic amount could be a 25 increase equivalent to 84165810 instead of a 50 increase

description.narrative: 7 Number of areas of biological importance declared by the Convention on Biological Diversity CBD and regulated by a ministerial decree

comment.narrative: One area of biological importance already declared by the CBD ie Cañon de San Jose
One area of biological importance already declared by CBD and regulated by Ministerial decree ie Cañon de San Jose

This is a new indicator The Cañon de San Jose biological area will be regulated by ministerial decree in 2016 The San José Canyon has been recognized by the Convention on Biological Diversity CBD as an Ecologically or Biologically Significant Marine Area EBSA The ministerial decree is needed to regulate the use white shark and sailfish amongst other key species
One area of biological importance already declared by CBD and regulated by Ministerial decree ie Cañon de San Jose

This is a new indicator The Cañon de San Jose biological area will be regulated by ministerial decree in 2016 The San José Canyon has been recognized by the Convention on Biological Diversity CBD as an Ecologically or Biologically Significant Marine Area EBSA The ministerial decree is needed to regulate the use white shark and sailfish amongst other key species

description.narrative: 5 Legal and regulatory framework facilitates the conservation and sustainable use of BD in the MPAs and buffer zones

comment.narrative: Regulations for Mangroves from the National Forest Institute INAB CONAP and Bureau of State Land Reserves OCRET
Regulatory reforms regarding the use and management of mangroves INABCONAPOCRET

Technical and legal opinions agreed and signed between INAB and CONAP for the regulatory reform regarding mangroves
Inter institutional legal opinion No 022015 June 18th
Joint technical opinion No 012015 June 17th
Final proposal to be presented for approval to the board of directors of INAB before the end of 2015
Regulations for Whale Cetaceans Watching were published in the official gazette on June 8th 2015 This support to CONAP will also include its dissemination with key local actors and guidelines to its effective implementation
Note A change of the indicator regarding the Law of Fishing and Aquaculture is requested with the support of the Technical Committee aiming to a more viable initiative The San José Canyon has been recognized by the Convention on Biological Diversity CBD as an Ecologically or Biologically Significant Marine Area EBSA Through a ministerial agreement it can be established as a ban area andor breeding area of key species particularly white shark and sailfish
Regulatory reforms regarding the use and management of mangroves INABCONAPOCRET

Technical and legal opinions agreed and signed between INAB and CONAP for the regulatory reform regarding mangroves
Inter institutional legal opinion No 022015 June 18th
Joint technical opinion No 012015 June 17th
Final proposal to be presented for approval to the board of directors of INAB before the end of 2015
Regulations for Whale Cetaceans Watching were published in the official gazette on June 8th 2015 This support to CONAP will also include its dissemination with key local actors and guidelines to its effective implementation
Note A change of the indicator regarding the Law of Fishing and Aquaculture is requested with the support of the Technical Committee aiming to a more viable initiative The San José Canyon has been recognized by the Convention on Biological Diversity CBD as an Ecologically or Biologically Significant Marine Area EBSA Through a ministerial agreement it can be established as a ban area andor breeding area of key species particularly white shark and sailfish

description.narrative: 11 Increase in the number of monitoring control and surveillance plans and patrolling events

comment.narrative:
Monitoring work plans 0
Patrolling events 0

Work plans 5 oneMPAyear during 5 years
Patrolling events 120 per MPA 2monthMPA during 5 years

One joint work plan including methodology and timeframe between DIPESCAMAGA CONAP and INAB has been built and from July to December it is expected to accomplish 5 patrolling events 1 x 5 MPA
A monitoring program per MPA will be agreed as part of the Management Plans to be elaborated in 2016

In March 2015 a workshop on Mangrove Forest Management was held with a field work at ManchónGuamuchal 24 technicians from INAB CONAP and ICC Private Institute on Climate Change were trained to address mangrove restoration more effectively
As a joint initiative with the ECOPLAN project from UNDP portfolio a training program on Land Use Planning in Coastal Marine Zones was developed in Monterrico from March to June 2015 Capacities were strengthened for the following sectorsinstitutions with a total of 20 technicians

description.narrative: (1) Number of hectares of marine and coastal areas under protection by MPAs in the Pacific. (2) Change in the management effectiveness (%) of La Chorrera Private Natural Reserve using METT scorecard. (3) Change in the management effectiveness of Sipacate-Naranjo National Park using METT scorecard. (4) Change in the management effectiveness of Monterrico Multiple-Use Natural Reserve using METT scorecard. (5) Change in the financial capacity of the MPAs using the Sustainability Scorecard %. (6) Number of Legal and regulatory documents that facilitates the conservation and sustainable use of BD in the MPAs and buffer zones (7) Total annual budget ($) from the central government assigned to the management of the MPAs and amount of financial resources received annually from private sources for the MPAs management (8) Number of management plans for existing and new MPAs (9) Number of staff from national and local governments, private sectors, and civil society, including women, trained in monitoring and control of threats to marine and coastal BD (10) Increase in the number of monitoring, control, and surveillance plans and patrolling events -- Monitoring Work plans (11) Increase in the number of monitoring, control, and surveillance plans and patrolling events -- Patrolling events (12) Number of hatchlings released by certified nurseries per reproductive period of the sea turtle Lepidochelys olivacea in the nesting beaches of the Pacific
